meanings.definition: Lower in social status or rank.
meanings.sent1: The old, worn-out clothes made him feel declasse among the well-dressed crowd.
meanings.sent2: She felt declasse when she couldn't afford to join her friends on their luxury vacation.
meanings.sent3: Despite his attempts to fit in, his declasse manners always stood out.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned mansion looked declasse compared to the grandeur of the neighboring estates.
meanings.sent5: The faded sign outside the diner gave it a declasse appearance.

meanings.definition: To lower in social status or rank.
meanings.sent1: The scandalous affair threatened to declasse the once-respected politician.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to declasse herself by associating with the disreputable crowd.
meanings.sent3: His decision to quit his job and travel the world was sure to declasse him in the eyes of his former colleagues.
meanings.sent4: The company's unethical practices would declasse its reputation in the industry.
meanings.sent5: The gossip about her family would declasse them in the eyes of the elite society.
